attributes.action: change the law to ensure that a mercy killing should never result in spending the rest of your life in prison.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Francis Inglis killed her own son to prevent his further suffering. She may never accept that what she did was wrong; she did it out of love for her son and to end his suffering after the negligence of the ambulance service. Given she may not show any 'remorse' she is likely to spend the rest of her life in prison, having been found guilty of murder. 

We petition the Primse Minister to change the law so that mercy killings should never result in a life sentence or a conviction for murder.
